question: Question_01_(a)
hints:
If you believe the statement is true, you need to show that for any two
polynomials the limit is always either 0 or $\displaystyle \pm \infty$.

If you believe the statement is false, you must give one example of two
polynomials \emph{f} and \emph{g} where the limit is neither 0 nor
$\displaystyle \pm \infty$.

When trying these types of problems, it is always a good idea to try a
few examples out first before trying to solve the problem just to get a
feeling of what is required.

Remember that the infinite limit of a function gives its horizontal
asymptotes. Is it possible for a function $f(x)/g(x)$ to have a
horizontal asymptote NOT at $0$?
